      • PSmiles

        public PSmiles(java.lang.String anInputStructure,
               boolean anIsMonomer,
               int aStartIndex,
               PointInSpace aFirstParticle,
               PointInSpace aLastParticle,
               double aBondLength)
        * Sets all properties of a PSmiles object.
        Parameters:
        anInputStructure - An input structure (may be a monomer)
        anIsMonomer - True: anInputStructure is a monomer, false: Otherwise (default: false)
        aStartIndex - First particle number in the PSmiles matrix (default: 1)
        aFirstParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single first particle
        aLastParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single last particle
        aBondLength - User defined bond length for all connections between particles

      • PSmiles

        public PSmiles(java.lang.String anInputStructure,
               java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> anAvailableParticles,
               boolean anIsMonomer,
               int aStartIndex,
               PointInSpace aFirstParticle,
               PointInSpace aLastParticle,
               double aBondLength)
        * Sets all properties of a PSmiles object.
        Parameters:
        anInputStructure - An input structure (may be a monomer)
        anAvailableParticles - Hashmap of available particles
        anIsMonomer - True: anInputStructure is a monomer, false: Otherwise (default: false)
        aStartIndex - First particle number in the PSmiles matrix (default: 1)
        aFirstParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single first particle
        aLastParticle - Cartesian coordinate of a single last particle
        aBondLength - User defined bond length for all connections between particles

        public PSmiles(java.lang.String anInputStructure,
               int aStartIndex,

        aFirstParticle - Cartesian coordinates of first particles
        aLastParticle - Cartesian coordinates of last particles
        aBondLength - User defined bond length for all connections between particles

        Returns Monomers

      • getParticlePositionsAndConnections

        public java.lang.String[][] getParticlePositionsAndConnections()
        Returns the PSmiles particle positions and connections. This matrix is structured as follows: 1. column: Particle number (1-based or startIndex-based), 2. column: Particle, 3. column: Backbone index 4. column: X-coordinate of the particle (if no coordinate information is specified: Beginning with 3rd column connected particle numbers are listed), 5. column: Y-coordinate of the particle, 6. column: Z-coordinate of the particle, 6ff. column: Relative particle positions to the the particle of other particles which are connected to the particle (e.g. "1" means a connection to the next particle, "-1" means a connection to the previous particle
        Returns:
        PSmiles particle positions and connections

      • getMaximumNumberOfConnectionsOfSingleParticle

        public int getMaximumNumberOfConnectionsOfSingleParticle()
        Maximum number of connections (bonds) of a single particle
        Returns:
        Maximum number of connections (bonds) of a single particle

      • getPartsOfPSmiles

        public PSmilesInner[] getPartsOfPSmiles()
        Parts of PSmiles
        Returns:
        If the structure consists of multiple parts a FSmile of each part is returned, otherwise null is returned.

      • getParticleToFrequencyMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ParticleFrequency> getParticleToFrequencyMap()
        HashMap that maps particles of molecule to their frequencies. NOTE: Molecular structure MUST be valid (NO checks are performed) and is NOT allowed to contain monomer shortcuts.
        Returns:
        HashMap that maps particles of molecule to their frequencies

      • getNextNeighbors

        public java.lang.String[][] getNextNeighbors(int aSegmentLength,
                                             boolean aHasDoublet)
        Determines all available neighbors
        Parameters:
        aSegmentLength - Length of segment (2: dimer, 3: trimer etc.)
        aHasDoublet - Whether doublet should be considered or not (e.g. if true "A-F" and "F-A" will be returned instead one of both)
        Returns:
        All available neighbors with all segment lengths until aSegmentLength: Index 0: Particles, Index 1: Dimers, Index 2: Trimes etc. up to index (aSegmentLength - 1)

      • getParticleCoordinates

        public PointInSpace[][] getParticleCoordinates(PointInSpace aFirstParticleCoordinate,
                                               PointInSpace aLastParticleCoordinate,
                                               double aBondLength)
        Returns coordinates of particles
        Parameters:
        aFirstParticleCoordinate - Coordinate of the first particle
        aLastParticleCoordinate - Coordinate of the last particle
        aBondLength - BondLength
        Returns:
        Coordinates of the particles (index of particle can be examined by getParticlesIndex() method). First index is index of molecular structure, second index is index of particle. If PointInSpaceInterface is unknown or different in aFirstParticleCoordinate and aLastParticleCoordinate null is returned.

      • getParticleCoordinates

        public PointInSpace[][] getParticleCoordinates(PointInSpace[] aFirstParticleCoordinates,
                                               PointInSpace[] aLastParticleCoordinates,
                                               double aBondLength)
        Returns coordinates of particles
        Parameters:
        aFirstParticleCoordinates - Coordinates of the first particle
        aLastParticleCoordinates - Coordinates of the last particle
        aBondLength - BondLength
        Returns:
        Coordinates of the particles (index of particle can be examined by getParticlesIndex() method) First index is index of molecular structure, second index is index of particle.

      • getMonomerList

        public java.lang.String[] getMonomerList()
        Returns monomer names of structure
        Returns:
        Monomer names of structure or null if none were found

      • getCoordinatesOfTokens

        protected PointInSpace[] getCoordinatesOfTokens(PSmiles aPSmilesBase,
                                                int aPartIndex,
                                                IPointInSpace aFirstParticleCoordinate,
                                                IPointInSpace aLastParticleCoordinate,
                                                double aBondLength)
        Get coordinate of tokens. NOTE: No checks are performed due to performance reasons.
        Parameters:
        aPSmilesBase: - A part of PSmiles
        aPartIndex: - Index of the part
        aFirstParticleCoordinate: - First particle coordinate
        aLastParticleCoordinate: - Last particle coordinate
        aBondLength: - Bond length
        Returns:
        Coordinate: of tokens
